citeinfo.title: Mangrove carbon stocks in Zambezi River Delta, Mozambique

descript.abstract: Carbon stocks in mangroves in the Zambezi River Delta of Mozambique (East Africa) were inventoried using a stratified random sampling approach from 2012 to 2016. A total 52 plots containing 287 subplots were objectively distributed using a GIS based spatial decision support system (SDSS) to represent the characteristics of mangroves and the operating constraints within the Delta area. The inventory was designed to provide estimates of above- and below-ground carbon stocks for the entire Delta. Data include species, height and diameter at breast height for overstory, understory and dead trees, mass of woody debris, litter, and ground vegetation. Data to estimate soil carbon and nitrogen content to 2 meters depth are also included.
descript.purpose: Mangroves are recognized for their numerous ecosystem services and functions that are critical to environmental health and human wellbeing in the regions where they occur and beyond. Although mangroves comprise only 0.7% of the world’s tropical forests, they have been shown to contain globally-significant carbon pools, storing up to five times more carbon than typical upland tropical forests per area. As a result, there is interest in considering mangroves in national climate adaptation and mitigation strategies, yet little research related to climate change and carbon sequestration has been completed in mangroves, especially in Africa. WWF-Mozambique’s project, Sustainable Finance for the Protected Areas System of Mozambique recommended development of a pilot project for carbon sequestration in the mangrove forests of the Zambezi Delta, Mozambique, with aims to conserve mangroves in the Zambezi River Delta through reforestation mechanisms and implementation of sustainable use and management activities with local stakeholders, financed sustainably through carbon markets. The USFS project, The Zambezi River Delta Mangrove Carbon Project: A Pilot Baseline Assessment for REDD+ Reporting and Monitoring is a foundational scientific component of the larger WWF effort, designed to quantify the mangrove carbon stocks to contribute to Mozambique’s REDD+ National Program by building in-country technical capacity and measuring the soil and vegetation carbon pools in the intact mangrove stands within the Zambezi River Delta.
descript.supplinf: This project was also used to assess the distribution of mangroves and change in distribution over time. The results of these analyses are available in Shapiro et al. 2015. Lidar data were also collected as part of this project for a portion of the Zambezi River Delta; that data along with remote sensing derived canopy height data are available online (Lagomasino et al. 2016).

spdom.descgeog: Zambezi River Delta, Mozambique in East Africa

classsys.classmod: 1. Instead of providing the taxonomy for Bruguiera gymnorrhiza, ITIS provided the taxonomy for the accepted name: Bruguiera gymnorhiza. 2. The taxonomy for Lumnitzera racemose was not available in ITIS, but it did provide the taxonomy for Lumnitzera.

idinfo.useconst:
These data were collected using funding from the U.S. Government and can be used without additional permissions or fees. If you use these data in a publication, presentation, or other research product please use the following citation:
Trettin, Carl C.; Stringer, Christina E.; Zarnoch, Stanley J.; Tang, Wenwu; Dai, Zhaohua. 2017. Mangrove carbon stocks in Zambezi River Delta, Mozambique. Fort Collins, CO: Forest Service Research Data Archive. https://doi.org/10.2737/RDS-2017-0053

The work was conducted in collaboration with World Wildlife Fund – Mozambique and the Department of Biology, Eduardo Mondlane University, Maputo.

attracc.attraccr:
Quality assurance (QA) and quality control (QC) were used for entire inventory process. The field sampling protocols for this project are based on methods developed by CIFOR and USFS (Kauffman and Donato 2012), which was developed based on established forest sampling methodologies and first-applied in Indo-Pacific mangrove forests.
Kauffman, J. Boone; Donato, Daniel C. 2012. Protocols for the measurement, monitoring and reporting of structure, biomass and carbon stocks in mangrove forests. Working Paper 86. Bogor, Indonesia: Center for International Forestry Research (CIFOR).

dataqual.logic: The protocol application for this project was to (a) utilize an established protocol to facilitate comparison with other projects, and (b) to assess whether the protocol needs to be adjusted for use in African mangrove forests. See \Supplements\Field_Methods_East_Africa.pdf for more details.
dataqual.complete: Missing field data is attributable failure to record information in the field; missing laboratory data are attributable to samples that were compromised during processing. Missing data are denoted with blank cells.

method.methdesc: An objective-based inventory was used to quantify the above and below-ground carbon stocks within the Zambezi River Delta. The forest canopy height (Lagomasino et al. 2016) was used as the basis for implementing a stratified random sampling design. Inventory plots were randomly assigned using a spatial decision support system (SDSS) and published forest inventory methods. A nested plot design was used for the measurements, whereby subplots were located systematically within the plot. The field sampling protocols were designed to facilitate the calculation of carbon stocks in vegetation components and soils. The approach was to estimate biomass using a combination of direct measurements (e.g, litter and ground vegetation biomass) and indirect measurements of diameter and height which were then used to estimate biomass, or in the case of dead wood, measurements to estimate biomass using published guidelines. The mangrove sediments were sampled in the field, to provide a basis for estimated soil carbon to a depth of 200 centimeters (cm). The field sampling was conducted by a large crew during two missions in 2012 and 2013. Plant biomass samples were processed at Eduardo Mondlane Universityto adjust field weights to an oven dry basis. Sediment samples were returned to the Forest Service laboratory, Cordesville, SC to measure bulk density and determination of carbon and nitrogen content. The forest inventory data were processed using generalized allometric equations, because at the time of the project local or regional equations were not available. Data were analyzed 2014-2016. See the citations below for more details on the sampling, analyses, and data representation.

citeinfo.title: CMS: Mangrove Canopy Height Estimates from Remote Imagery, Zambezi Delta, Mozambique

srcinfo.srccontr: This data set provides canopy height estimates for mangrove forests in the Zambezi Delta, Mozambique, Africa. The estimates were derived from three separate canopy height models (CHM) using airborne lidar, stereophotogrammetry with WorldView 1 imagery, and Interferometric-Synthetic Aperture Radar (In-SAR) techniques with TanDEM-X imagery. The data cover the period 2011-10-14 to 2014-05-06. Each CHM was resampled to 1 meter x 1 meter to match the spatial sampling of the airborne Lidar data set. All data sets were clipped to the extent of the Lidar coverage and subsequently masked to the regions of mangrove tree cover identified by Giri et al. 2014. Each CHM covered an approximate mangrove area of 6,118 hectares.

procstep.procdesc: All data presented are raw data, with the exception of the soil bulk density. The soil bulk density was determined by measuring the volume of the soil core obtained from the specified soil depths and dividing that by the oven-dry (105°Celsius) mass of soil, yield the bulk density in units of: grams per cubic meters.

overview.eaover:
\Data\Zambezi_Overstory.csv: Comma-delimited ASCII text file containing tree (> 5 centimeters diameter breast height) inventory data collected within the measurement subplots. Variables are defined below.
Plot: Number of the mangrove plot that is a specific area of a mangrove forest selected for mangrove inventory.
Subplot: Number of the subplot that is a small mangrove area within a plot.
Height Class: Tree heights were classified into 5 classes; 1: 2 – 6.9 meters (m), 2: 7 – 9.9 m, 3: 10 – 12.9 m, 4: 13 – 17.9 m, 5: 18 – 29 m.
Species Code: Used to represent mangrove species; 1: Ceriops tagal, 2: Bruguiera gymnorrhiza, 3: Xylocarpus granatum, 4: Sonneratia alba, 5: Avicennia marina, 6: Rhizophora mucronata, 7: Heritiera littoralis, 8: Lumnitzera racemose, 88: Unknown.
Live Diameter: Tree diameter at breast height for live trees, unit: centimeters (cm).
Dead Diameter: Tree diameter at breast height for dead trees, unit: cm.
Dead Code: Used to describe the decay status of standing dead trees; 1: newly died trees, 2: small branches lost, 3: only bole left.
Height: Heights of live and/or dead trees, unit: m.
overview.eadetcit: Stringer, Christina E.; Trettin, Carl C.; Zarnoch, Stanley J.; Tang, Wenwu. 2015. Carbon stocks of mangroves within the Zambezi River Delta, Mozambique. For. Ecol. Mgt. 354:139-148. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.foreco.2015.06.027

overview.eaover:
\Data\Zambezi_soils.csv: Comma-delimited ASCII text file containing soil data collected within the measurement subplots. Data were collected to estimate soil carbon stocks to 2 meters below the soil surface. Variables are defined below.
Plot: Number of the mangrove plot that is a specific area of a mangrove forest selected for mangrove inventory.
Subplot: Number of the subplot that is a small mangrove area within a plot.
Interval: Represented a soil sample depth, coding from 1 to 6; 1: 5-10 centimeters (cm), 2: 20-25 cm, 3: 35-40 cm, 4: 70-75 cm, 5: 145-150 cm, 6: 190-195 cm.
Actual Sample Interval: The actual soil depth that was sampled, this provision was included in the event that core length had to constrained due to soil conditions, unit: cm.
Actual Core Length: The objective was to collect 5 cm cores, this attribute reflects the actual length of soil core, unit: cm.
Bulk Density: Soil bulk density, unit: grams per cubic centimeters (g cm-3).
%C: Carbon concentration at relevant soil layer, unit: percent.
%N: Nitrogen concentration at relevant soil layer, unit: percent.
overview.eadetcit: Stringer, Christina E.; Trettin, Carl C.; Zarnoch, Stanley J.; Tang, Wenwu. 2015. Carbon stocks of mangroves within the Zambezi River Delta, Mozambique. For. Ecol. Mgt. 354:139-148. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.foreco.2015.06.027

overview.eaover:
\Data\Zambezi_Understory.csv: Comma-delimited ASCII text file containing tree (< 5 centimeters diameter breast height) inventory data collected within the measurement subplots. Variables are defined below.
Plot: Number of the mangrove plot that is a specific area of a mangrove forest selected for mangrove inventory.
Subplot: Number of the subplot that is a small mangrove area within a plot.
Species Code: Used to represent mangrove species; 1: Ceriops tagal, 2: Bruguiera gymnorrhiza, 3: Xylocarpus granatum, 4: Sonneratia alba, 5: Avicennia marina, 6: Rhizophora mucronata, 7: Heritiera littoralis, 8: Lumnitzera racemose, 88: Unknown.
Diameter: Tree diameter at breast height, unit: centimeters (cm).
Height: Heights of live and/or dead trees, unit: meters (m).
overview.eadetcit:
Stringer, Christina E.; Trettin, Carl C.; Zarnoch, Stanley J.; Tang, Wenwu. 2015. Carbon stocks of mangroves within the Zambezi River Delta, Mozambique. For. Ecol. Mgt. 354:139-148. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.foreco.2015.06.027
Trettin, Carl C., Stringer, Christina E.; Zarnoch, Stanley J. 2015. Composition, biomass and structure of mangroves within the Zambezi River Delta. Wetlands Ecology Management 24(2):173-186. https://doi.org/10.1007/s11273-015-9465-8

overview.eaover:
\Data\Zambezi_WoodyDebris_CWD.csv: Comma-delimited ASCII text file containing coarse woody debris (CWD) data collected within the measurement subplots. Variables are defined below for each sheet within this file.
Plot: Number of the mangrove plot that is a specific area of a mangrove forest selected for mangrove inventory.
Subplot: Number of the subplot that is a small mangrove area within a plot.
Transect: Transect of the subplot (E=east, N=north, S=south, W=West).
THE REST OF THESE DATA ARE DEADWOOD DATA TALLIED IN THE FIELD BY SIZE
--Measurements & Tallies--
Large Solid: Diameter of large solid wood > 7.6 centimeters (cm) in diameter, unit: cm.
Large Solid Squared: Diameter, unit: squared centimeters (cm2).
Large Rotten: Diameter of large rotten wood diameter > 7.6 cm, unit: cm.
Large Rotten Squared: Diameter of large rotten wood, unit: cm2.
Medium: Tally of medium size class (2.5 to 7.6 cm). 5.05
Small: Tally of small size class (0.6 to 2.4 cm). 1.5
Fine: Tally of fine size class (0.0 to 0.5 cm).
--Volumes (cubmic meters per hectare)--
Large Solid2: Calculated volume large solid class, unit: cubic meters per hectare (m3 ha-1).
Large Rotten3: Calculated volume large rotten class, unit: m3 ha-1.
Medium4: Calculated volume medium class, unit: m3 ha-1. (Quadratic Mean Diameter is 5.25 cm for this class)
Small5: Calculated volume small class, unit: m3 ha-1. (Quadratic Mean Diameter is 1.55 cm for this class)
Fine6: Calculated volume large fine class, unit: m3 ha-1. (Quadratic Mean Diameter is 0.3 cm for this class)
--Mass (kilograms per hectare)--
Large Solid7: Calculated mass large solid class, unit: kilograms per hectare (kg ha-1). (Specific gravity is 0.69 kg m-3)
Large Rotten8: Calculated mass large rotten class, unit: kg ha-1. (Specific gravity is 0.29 kg m-3)
Medium9: Calculated mass medium class, unit: kg ha-1. (Specific gravity is 0.71 kg m-3)
Small10: Calculated mass small class, unit: kg ha-1. (Specific gravity is 0.64 kg m-3)
Fine11: Calculated mass fine class, unit: kg ha-1. (Specific gravity is 0.48 kg m-3)
overview.eadetcit: Stringer, Christina E.; Trettin, Carl C.; Zarnoch, Stanley J.; Tang, Wenwu. 2015. Carbon stocks of mangroves within the Zambezi River Delta, Mozambique. For. Ecol. Mgt. 354:139-148. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.foreco.2015.06.027

overview.eaover:
\Data\Zambezi_WoodyDebris_LitterandLive.csv: Comma-delimited ASCII text file containing litter and live ground vegetation data collected within the measurement subplots. Variables are defined below for each sheet within this file.
Plot: Number of the mangrove plot that is a specific area of a mangrove forest selected for mangrove inventory.
Subplot: Number of the subplot that is a small mangrove area within a plot. (comp = total of subplots 1-5)
Litter (kg): Fresh weight of dead litter, unit: kilograms per square meter (kg m-2).
Live (kg): Fresh weight of vegetation < 1.3 meters (m) in height, unit: kg m-2.
Litter Corrected for % MC: Litter weight corrected for moisture content, unit: kg m-2.
Ash Content (g/g): Proportion of ash.
Litter Corrected for Ash: Litter weight corrected for ash content, unit: kg m-2.
Notes: This was used to note when there were ferns in the ground vegetation, if it is not noted it implies seedlings and other woody vegetation. (Ferns were the unusual occurrence so the plot would have higher values.).
overview.eadetcit: Stringer, Christina E.; Trettin, Carl C.; Zarnoch, Stanley J.; Tang, Wenwu. 2015. Carbon stocks of mangroves within the Zambezi River Delta, Mozambique. For. Ecol. Mgt. 354:139-148. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.foreco.2015.06.027

overview.eaover:
Supplemental files containing additional information about these data and the study are also included in the data publication download. The files are described below.
\Supplements\Field_Methods_East_Africa.pdf: Adobe Acrobat PDF/a file containing a description of the field sampling protocols ("Mangrove Carbon Stock Inventory: Field Methods") developed to support the mangrove carbon stock inventory.
\Supplements\FinalReport_MozMan_English.pdf: Adobe Acrobat PDF file containing the final project report ("The Zambezi River Delta Mangrove Carbon Project: A Pilot Baseline Assessment for REDD+ Reporting and Monitoring"). It also contains maps showing the plot locations and additional reporting of the results.
\Supplements\Pictures_Field_Mission_Report_1.pdf: Adobe Acrobat PDF file containing pictures taken during the 2013 field mission.
\Supplements\Pictures_Zambezi.pdf: Adobe Acrobat PDF file containing selected photos taken during the 2012 and 2013 field missions.

distinfo.distliab:
Metadata documents have been reviewed for accuracy and completeness. Unless otherwise stated, all data and related materials are considered to satisfy the quality standards relative to the purpose for which the data were collected. However, neither the author, the Archive, nor any part of the federal government can assure the reliability or suitability of these data for a particular purpose. The act of distribution shall not constitute any such warranty, and no responsibility is assumed for a user's application of these data or related materials.
The metadata, data, or related materials may be updated without notification. If a user believes errors are present in the metadata, data or related materials, please use the information in (1) Identification Information: Point of Contact, (2) Metadata Reference: Metadata Contact, or (3) Distribution Information: Distributor to notify the author or the Archive of the issues.
